cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: lingering over the north coast of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn northwest later today, then north-northwest on Sunday, moving through the Florida Keys, up the southwest coast of Florida, and inland across Georgia toward Tennessee
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Keys Sunday morning, then near the southwest Florida coast (around Naples) Sunday afternoon

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Edisto Beach to South Santee River, SC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Isle of Palms SC to Fernandina Beach FL (storm-surge zone 4–6 ft)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph, gusts higher) possible late Monday into Tuesday with a 25 % chance of 34 kt winds and a 3 % chance of 50 kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–6 ft surge possible along the Charleston area coast as onshore flow increases while the center passes inland to the west.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible, leading to flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and isolated tornadoes cannot be ruled out.
